name: places/ChIJU7iN7khZwokRPd6DagJkAwc
formattedAddress: 401 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 401 W 45th St, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text:
It was/is a good idea, and I am sympathetic to the needs of people living on the streets.

However, at this point the negative impact on the neighborhood far outweighs the benefits.  For every person this helps, I am seeing several folks make a mess of this place and they then make a mess elsewhere on the block.

Overall, it’s drawing too many people that are a danger to residents in the neighborhood who are just trying to live their lives.  Again, I understand there were good intentions behind this, but we have to be able to direct our energies toward ways to help those less fortunate without the severe negative consequences to the local residents’ lives.

============================
Update on 4-28-2023 in response to owner's comments.
I'm not exactly sure how to respond in a way that leaves a more legible trail, so apologies for the formatting.

At a substantive level, I have no doubt that the store is generating all the positive impact that you described.  I do see volunteers cleaning up the area, it definitely is an added touchpoint for neighbors to interact, and I too have placed several gently used items there knowing that someone else can use it thus limiting both trash and harm to the environment from unnecessary production of hard goods.

I was simply trying to say that the cost to those most proximate to the area is quite high and should be a part of the calculus.  Folks who are a danger to themselves and others are coming through this area with very high frequency.  It's unreasonable to expect volunteers to staff the place 24/7, and so more often than
not, the store is in shambles.  They often grab a bagful of items, and then I find them discarded all along the rest of 45th street.

Again, I applaud the effort and heart behind this.  I just think after a year or so of running a laudable experiment, the costs have outweighed the benefits.

originalText.text: Just a hub for the homeless to hang out and harass those who live on the street. People are getting followed home and assaulted from the people who stand here 24/7. It's disgusting and useless. Please shut it down!

text.text: Just a hub for the homeless to hang out and harass those who live on the street. People are getting followed home and assaulted from the people who stand here 24/7. It's disgusting and useless. Please shut it down!

originalText.text: Would rate it 0 stars but cant. Thier is nothing their anymore. All the homless come and take everything to try and sell on the street. Not worth the time and another thing is some of the women like to take everything even if it's not needed. Use to come when it first started and now it's a waste of time.

originalText.text: This place is a great help to our local houseless and recently housed community many thanks to all those who contribute over there, there should be one of these every ave or every other Ave at least
